location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Thomas Hodges, East India Company Governor at Bombay, and Daniel Draper, James Ryley, Rawson Hart Boddam, and Benjamin Jervis, all part of the Council at Bombay Castle, to James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter announces the official appointment of Morley as Resident at Bushire and of George Green as his assistant. Included are instructions for the supplying and dispatching of the ships Success, Eagle,and Fancywhen they arrive at Bushire, and an account of woollens to be sent to Bussora [Basra].
